t: Job 33
Elihu Contradicts Job
“But*pn please, Job, hear my speech, And*ld listen to all my words.
Now,*ld I open my mouth; My*ld tongue speaks in my mouth.
My*ld words come*i from my upright heart; My*ld lips utter pure knowledge.
The*ld Spirit of God has made me, And*ld the breath of the Almighty gives me life.
If*ld you can answer me, Set*ld your*i words*i in order before me; Take*ld your stand.
Truly*ld I am*i as your spokesman before God; I*ld also have been formed out of clay.
Surely*ld no fear of me will terrify you, Nor*ld will my hand be heavy on you.
“Surely*ln you have spoken in my hearing, And*ld I have heard the sound of your*i words, saying,*i
‘I*ld am*i pure, without transgression; I*ld am*i innocent, and there*i is*i no iniquity in me.
Yet*ld He finds occasions against me, He*ld counts me as His enemy;
He*ld puts my feet in the stocks, He*ld watches all my paths.’
“Look,*ln in*i this you are not righteous. I*ld will answer you, For*ld God is greater than man.
Why*ld do you contend with Him? For*ld He does not give an accounting of any of His words.
For*ld God may speak in one way, or in another, Yet*ild man*i does not perceive it.
In*ld a dream, in a vision of the night, When*ld deep sleep falls upon men, While*ld slumbering on their beds,
Then*ld He opens the ears of men, And*ld seals their instruction.
In*ld order to turn man from*i his*i deed, And*ld conceal pride from man,
He*ld keeps back his soul from the Pit, And*ld his life from perishing by the sword.
“Man*iln is also chastened with pain on his bed, And*ld with strong pain*i in many of his bones,
So*ld that his life abhors bread, And*ld his soul succulent food.
His*ld flesh wastes away from sight, And*ld his bones stick out which*i once*i were not seen.
Yes,*ld his soul draws near the Pit, And*ld his life to the executioners.
“If*ln there is a messenger for him, A*ld mediator, one among a thousand, To*ld show man His uprightness,
Then*ld He is gracious to him, and says, ‘Deliver*ld him from going down to the Pit; I*ld have found a ransom’;
His*ld flesh shall be young like a child’s, He*ld shall return to the days of his youth.
He*ld shall pray to God, and He will delight in him, He*ld shall see His face with joy, For*ld He restores to man His righteousness.
Then*ld he looks at men and says, ‘I*ld have sinned, and perverted what*i was*i right, And*ld it did not profit me.’
He*ld will redeem his soul from going down to the Pit, And*ld his life shall see the light.
“Behold,*ln God works all these things,*i Twice,*ld in*i fact,*i three times*i with a man,
To*ld bring back his soul from the Pit, That*ld he may be enlightened with the light of life.
“Give*ln ear, Job, listen to me; Hold*ld your peace, and I will speak.
If*ld you have anything to say, answer me; Speak,*ld for I desire to justify you.
If*ld not, listen to me; Hold*ld your peace, and I will teach you wisdom.”
